value.title: Is AI – a magic bullet to combat COVID-19?
value.excerpt: Doctors and health tech experts inform that AI is no more alien to the domain, the pandemic has emphasised that it is a necessity and not a luxury

value.title: Basic ethical questions of transparency and bias in AI remain unsolved, experts say
value.excerpt: Big Tech companies are expected to perform a delicate balancing act in advancing AI development, while ensuring the technology’s ethical application.

value.title: Ethical AI will not see broad adoption by 2030, study suggests
value.excerpt: According to a survey by the Pew Research Center and Elon University, experts don't believe ethical AI will be broadly adopted soon.

value.title: State of AI report: AI industry showing strong signs of maturity in 2021
value.excerpt: The findings not only show a maturing industry, they also serve as a useful resource for AI practitioners working on their own deployments.

value.title: AI Ethics Q&A Series: Minimize And Mitigate Algorithmic Harm
value.excerpt: Cornell's Manish Raghavan talks about ways to minimize and mitigate the negative impacts of AI and the most significant barriers to organizational change.

value.title: DataRobot exec talks ‘humble’ AI, regulation
value.excerpt: Ted Kwartler, vice president of trusted AI at DataRobot, says AI models need to be humble enough to enable humans to keep them relevant.

value.title: Explainer: Ethical Issues Proliferate Amid the Use of Artificial Intelligence in COVID-19 Healthcare

value.title: How stakeholder capitalism and AI ethics go hand in hand
value.excerpt: With the prevalence of AI technologies across businesses, AI ethics will soon become critical components of stakeholder capitalism.

value.title: Transform 2021 puts the spotlight on women in AI
value.excerpt: VB Event Elevate your enterprise data technology and strategy at Transform 2021. VentureBeat is proud to bring back the Women in AI Breakfast and Awards online for Transform 2021. In the male-dominated tech industry,

value.title: US creates AI data-sharing task force
value.excerpt: The Biden administration has created a task force to promote access to data and other resources to boost artificial intelligence (AI) research. The National Artificial Intelligence Research Resource Task Force involves the White House and the National Science Foundation.

value.title: German Bundestag passes new law on supply chain ethics
value.excerpt: The law will require German companies to report human rights or environmental abuses by suppliers. Supporters say it is a milestone, rights groups say it falls short.

value.title: How AI could radically change education and standardized testing
value.excerpt: Commentary: Find out how artificial intelligence could help shape new, game-changing forms of student assessment.

value.title: Protecting The Human: Ethics In AI
value.excerpt: Advancements in AI and technology are meant to make our lives easier, yet they pose a threat to society when they are not perfect.

value.title: Researchers win $4.4 million in grants for projects using AI to take on climate change
value.excerpt: The C3.ai Digital Transformation Institute announced on Thursday $4.4 million in awards to researchers using everything from offline reinforcement learning and large-scale simulations to soil samples and seaweed to find solutions to climate change.

value.title: Government and business can develop an ethical AI future together, KPMG study finds
value.excerpt: Industry leaders believe the Biden administration will help advance AI adoption, and also believe it has an essential role in regulating AI.

value.title: Investors Call for Ethical Approach to Facial Recognition Technology
value.excerpt: A group of 50 investors managing more than $4.5 trillion in assets is calling on companies involved in the development and use of facial recognition technology, such as Amazon and Facebook, to do so in an ethical way.

value.title: From Inclusion To Influence: How To Build An Ethical AI Organization
value.excerpt: Ethical AI issues don’t come in large forms, they start with minor algorithm errors and grow into the decision-making process, which is why organizations should be well prepared with AI ethical framework.

value.title: NSW Police Force is using AI to analyse CCTV footage
value.excerpt: Police Force is using artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning to speed up investigations by automating manual tasks. The force's AI-infused platform, called Insights, gives police access to a wide array of critical information and automates many tasks such as transcribing recordings of audio interviews or poring through petabytes of CCTV footage.

value.title: Microsoft’s Kate Crawford: ‘AI is neither artificial nor intelligent’
value.excerpt: The AI researcher on how natural resources and human labour drive machine learning and the regressive stereotypes that are baked into its algorithms

value.title: As AI develops, so does the debate over profits and ethics
value.excerpt: But what remains unknowable are the benefits that may be lost to society by not fully using AI in responsible ways. We understandably recoil at the possibility of technology companies gaining privileged access to confidential medical records.

value.title: Google says it’s committed to ethical AI research. Its ethical AI team isn’t so sure.
value.excerpt: Six months after Timnit Gebru left, Google’s ethical artificial intelligence team is still in a state of upheaval.

value.title: Collaborative Contracting Can Help Combat Bias In AI
value.excerpt: To mitigate bias in artificial intelligence technology amid pending EU and U.S. regulations, contracting companies should consider each party's role in controlling for bias, rather than applying binary liability allocations,

value.title: The potential of artificial intelligence to bring equity in health care
value.excerpt: Nearly 1,400 joined MIT's AI for Health Care Equity Conference that explored new artificial intelligence technologies as a platform for change.

value.title: What Artificial Intelligence Still Can’t Do
value.excerpt: Modern artificial intelligence is capable of wonders. It can produce breathtaking original content: poetry, prose, images, music, human faces. It can diagnose some medical conditions more accurately than a human physician.

value.title: AI is having a big impact, but not how you think
value.excerpt: Commentary: AI is slowly, incrementally changing the world in ways that might not be obvious to the casual onlooker. Learn about startups that use AI to reduce food waste, improve education and more.

value.title: Google ethical AI group’s turmoil began long before public unravelling

value.title: AI Ethics Teams Bulk Up in Size, Influence at Tech Firms
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence ethics teams are playing a greater role at tech companies and helping them deal with bias and fairness issues that have cropped up at companies such as Twitter.
